titlepage.titleproper: Guide to the Caleb Stockton Chambers Collection1832-1833
titlepage.author: Finding aid prepared by TH, 2015

did.head: Descriptive Summary

address.addressline: Hanna Holborn Gray Special Collections Research Center

did.abstract: Caleb Stockton Chambers (born circa 1815) was a student in Washington, Pennsylvania, presumably at Washington & Jefferson College. This collection contains a selection of letters written to Chambers by his family members in 1832 and 1833.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

prefercite.head: Citation
prefercite.p: When quoting material from this collection, the preferred citation is: Chambers, Caleb Stockton. Collection, [Box #, Folder #], Hanna Holborn Gray Special Collections Research Center, University of Chicago Library

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Caleb Stockton Chambers was born in late 1815 or early 1816 to Arthur and Elainor Chambers. He was baptized at the Presbyterian Church of the Upper West Conogogheaue on February 25, 1816. Nothing is known of his early life, but judging from the letters in this collection, Chambers was raised in a very religious household. He later went on to college in Washington, Pennsylvania. It is unknown which college he was attending when he received these letters, as no direct mention is made, but it may have been Washington & Jefferson College. The school was established in 1781 by John McMillan, Thaddeus Dod, and Joseph Smith, three Presbyterian missionaries. As the most prominent college in the city and with its religious foundations, it is likely Chambers attended.

scopecontent.head: Scope Note
scopecontent.p: The Caleb Stockton Chambers Collection contains 6 items. These items are all letters written to Stockton from various members of his family – including his father, Arthur, his mother, Elainor, and his grandmother, Jane McFarland - while he was at college in Washington, PA. Five of the letters are silked. The letters date from late 1832 to mid-1833. All letters are arranged in chronological order. ;
The collection was previously part of the Miscellaneous Manuscripts Collection.;

list.item: Letter: Elainor Chambers to Caleb Chambers, December 5, 1832
Letter: Elainor Chambers to Caleb Chambers, January 8, 1833
Letter: Unknown to Caleb Chambers, January 30, 1833
Letter: Jane McFarland to Caleb Chambers, February 23, 1833
Letter: Arthur Chambers, Elainor Chambers to Caleb Chambers, June 18, 1833
Letter: Arthur Chambers to Caleb Chambers, July 29, 1833
